etymology.description: 鼓(鼓) (gǔ, "drum") + 楼(樓) (lóu, "tower") refers to a traditional structure often found in Chinese cities, where drums were used to signal time or events.
etymology.interpretation: A 鼓(鼓) (gǔ, "drum") is placed in a 楼(樓) (lóu, "tower") and used to signal time in ancient China. Drum towers were central to city life, serving as public timekeepers and ceremonial spaces.
etymology.simplification: 楼 is simplified from 樓

examples.chinese: 到北京旅游一定要去看看鼓楼(鼓樓)。
examples.pinyin: Dào Běijīng lǚyóu yīdìng yào qù kànkàn gǔ lóu.
examples.english: When traveling to Beijing, you must visit the Drum Tower.

examples.chinese: 傍晚时分(傍晚時分)，鼓楼散发出古老的韵味(鼓樓散發出古老的韻味)。
examples.pinyin: Bàngwǎn shí fēn, gǔ lóu sànfā chū gǔlǎo de yùnwèi.
examples.english: In the evening, the Drum Tower exudes an ancient charm.
